related.meaning: places alongside a railway line, bus route, major thoroughfare, etc.

lessons.japanese: 沿岸地帯には津波警報が出た。
lessons.english: The coast was warned against a tsunami.

lessons.japanese: トロール漁船は沿岸の魚をとりつくしました。
lessons.english: Fishing trawlers have fished out all the local waters.

lessons.japanese: 船は沿岸に向かって急いで進んだ。
lessons.english: The ship made for the shore.

lessons.japanese: 天気予報によると、台風は沿岸に接近しそうだ。
lessons.english: According to the weather forecast, the typhoon is likely to approach the coast.

lessons.japanese: 船は沿岸に向かって急いで進んだ。
lessons.english: The ship made for the shore.

lessons.japanese: 数年後、ヨーロッパ人たちは沿岸の植民地に住み着いた。
lessons.english: Years later, Europeans established colonies in the coastal areas.

lessons.japanese: 沿岸地帯には津波警報が出た。
lessons.english: The coast was warned against a tsunami.

lessons.japanese: 天気予報によると、台風は沿岸に接近しそうだ。
lessons.english: According to the weather forecast, the typhoon is likely to approach the coast.

lessons.japanese: 世界人口の三分の一が、沿岸部に住んでいる。
lessons.english: More than a third of the world population lives near a coast.

lessons.english: More than a third of the world population lives near a coast.
